Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 05:41AM hmillar wrote: I had a lumpectomy and SNB on 9/7. My arm is still sore almost three weeks later, even though they only took one node. The auxiliary at my hospital, UCSF, makes little pillows that you can place under your arm to minimize the rubbing and movement. This has been a lifesaver. Try this if you're still hurting, and don't forget to stretch as you get better. I'm amazed at how stiff my arm seems to become as I heal.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and SNB after effect questions spitnspunk hmillar

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 05:25AM hmillar wrote: Good luck, and I agree with the others. Stay busy. But I do wonder: why is cancer not oval? I am a recent diagnosis (2 months ago) and don't know about these things.
Posts.Title: What happens next? RDH jennem

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 06:50AM hmillar wrote: I am pretty sure I am going to have to have chemo. I am pre menopausal, have DCIS and IDC, but stage 3. Recovering for lumpectomy, SNB. This list is great!! Thank you so, so much, all of you who compiled it. It somehow makes the prospect of chemo less frightening.
